info.title: RPC client for Tendermint
info.description: A REST interface for state queries, transaction generation and broadcasting.

servers.description: Binance Chain mainnet node to interact with the Tendermint RPC
Binance Chain testnet node to interact with the Tendermint RPC
Interact with the Tendermint RPC locally on your device

tags.name: Websocket
tags.description: Subscribe/unsubscribe are reserved for websocket events.

get.description: Get Tendermint status including node info, pubkey, latest block hash, app hash, block height and time.
Get node health. Returns empty result (200 OK) on success, no response - in case of an error.

get.summary: Get block headers for minHeight <= height <= maxHeight.

200.description: Block headers, returned in descending order (highest first).

get.summary: Get block at a specified height

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height to return. If no height is provided, it will fetch the latest block.

get.summary: Get block results at a specified height

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height to return. If no height is provided, it will fetch information regarding the latest block.

get.summary: Get commit results at a specified height

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height to return. If no height is provided, it will fetch commit information regarding the latest block.

get.summary: Get validator set at a specified height

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height to return. If no height is provided, it will fetch validator set which corresponds to the latest block.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height to return. If no height is provided, it will fetch commit information regarding the latest block.

get.summary: Get the list of unconfirmed transactions

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of unconfirmed transactions to return

parameters.name: prove
parameters.description: Include proofs of the transactions inclusion in the block

get.summary: Returns with the response from CheckTx. Does not wait for DeliverTx result.
get.description:
If you haven't received anything after a couple of blocks, resend it. If the
same happens again, send it to some other node. A few reasons why it could
happen:
1. Your transaction is not valid 
2. node can be offline

If you want to be sure that the transaction is included in a block, you can
subscribe for the result using JSONRPC via a websocket.

To tell which events you want, you need to provide a query. 

query is a string, which has a form: "condition AND condition ..." (no OR at the moment). condition has a form: "key operation operand". key is a string with a restricted set of possible symbols ( \t\n\r\\()"'=>< are not allowed).

operation can be "=", "<", "<=", ">", ">=", "CONTAINS" AND "EXISTS". operand
can be a string (escaped with single quotes), number, date or time.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
query is a string, which has a form: "condition AND condition ..." (no OR at the
moment). condition has a form: "key operation operand". key is a string with
a restricted set of possible symbols ( \t\n\r\\()"'=>< are not allowed).
operation can be "=", "<", "<=", ">", ">=", "CONTAINS". operand can be a
string (escaped with single quotes), number, date or time.

operation can be "=", "<", "<=", ">", ">=", "CONTAINS". operand can be a

get.summary: Unsubscribe from all events via WebSocket
get.description: Unsubscribe from all events via WebSocket

get.summary: Returns right away, with no response. Does not wait for CheckTx nor DeliverTx results.
get.description:
If you haven't received anything after a couple of blocks, resend it. If the
same happens again, send it to some other node. A few reasons why it could
happen:
1. Your transaction is not valid 
2. node can be offline

If you want to be sure that the transaction is included in a block, you can
subscribe for the result using JSONRPC via a websocket.

get.summary: Returns with the responses from CheckTx and DeliverTx.
get.description:
The transaction will be broadcasted and returns with the response from `CheckTx` and `DeliverTx`.

This method will wait for both `CheckTx` and  `DeliverTx`, so it is the slowest way to broadcast through RPC but offers the most accurate success/failure response.

**CONTRACT** only returns error if mempool.CheckTx() errs or if we timeout waiting for tx to commit.

If `CheckTx` or `DeliverTx` fail, no error will be returned, but the returned result will contain a non-OK ABCI code.

Log.example: Dialing seeds in progress. See /net_info for details
